prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.434, 0.2402]. In this coordinate system, create the following 2D sketch on face_1: - Loop_1: - line_1: Start point at [0.0, 0.0], end point at [0.2498, 0.0] - line_2: Start point at [0.2498, 0.0], end point at [0.2498, 0.2138] - line_3: Start point at [0.2498, 0.2138], end point at [0.0, 0.2138] - line_4: Start point at [0.0, 0.2138], end point at [0.0, 0.0] Each curve forms a side of the rectangle. The loop is closed, forming the face. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling factor 0.2498, then transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal, with an extrusion depth of 0.434 units. Label this feature 'NewBodyFeatureOperation'. The result is a rectangular prism with following dimensions: - Length: 0.2498 - Width: 0.434 - Height: 0.2498 **Part 2: Construct a three-dimensional geometric shape with a flat base and a triangular top.** Create a new coordinate system under the same conditions as 'Part 1'. Create a 2D sketch on face_1 with the following components in 'loop_1': - line_1: Start point at [0.0, 0.0], end point at [0.2329, 0.0] - line_2: Start point at [0.2329, 0.0], end point at [0.2329, 0.316] - line_3: Start point at [0.2329, 0.316], end point at [0.0, 0.0] This sketch forms an isosceles triangle, with all lines connected end-to-end in a closed loop. Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling factor 0.316, then transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch under the provided coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal with an extrusion depth of 0.2893 units. Label this feature 'JoinFeatureOperation'. The result is a geometric shape with a flat base and triangular top with following dimensions: - Length: 0.316 - Width: 0.316 - Height: 0.2893 **Part 3: Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top.** Within a new coordinate system under different conditions than previous parts, create the following components in 'loop_1', on the first face: - circle_1: Center at [0.2402, 0.2402], radius of 0.2402 In 'loop_2': - circle_1: Center at [0.2402, 0.2402], radius of 0.0842 Scale the 2D sketch using the scaling factor 0.4803, then transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch under the provided coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal, with an extrusion depth of 0.434 units. Label this feature 'JoinFeatureOperation'. The result is the final shape, a cylindrical object with slightly tapering top and following dimensions - Length: 0.434 - Width: 0.4803 - Height: 0.4803</description>

Draw a circle using one arc: * Arc 1: Starting point at the top of the circle (0.375, 0.2166), ending point at the bottom of the circle (0.375, 0.1166), midpoint at the center of the circle (0.375, 0.1666) Step 2: Scale the Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 3: Transform the Sketch into a 3D Sketch Define the transformation using euler angles (0, 0, 0) and the translation vector (0, 0, 0). Step 4: Extrude the Sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction with a depth of 0.09 units, and with no extrusion in the opposite direction. Set the sketch scale to 0.75 and apply the NewBodyFeatureOperation. Description The resulting shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width, and the length of the sides is equal. The dimensions are: * Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom * Length: 0.75 units * Width: 0.75 units * Height: 0.09 units</description>
